main event: On July 10, 1957, a brilliant white light was observed moving steadily from west to east in Hartford, Connecticut.
interesting points: The object was compared to four stars, appearing at least 10 times larger., The sighting lasted approximately 25-30 seconds., The object was located at an estimated altitude of 70,000 feet., There were multiple reports of similar sightings across New England., The radar operator first detected the object before visually confirming it with binoculars.
witness description: LT COL FRANK P. WOOLLEY JR., USAF
